```{python}
import pandas as pd

# Load the dataset
url = 'https://github.com/fivethirtyeight/data/raw/master/star-wars-survey/StarWars.csv'
df = pd.read_csv(url, encoding='ISO-8859-1')

# Identify the relevant column and count non-missing values
# The column name is "Have you seen any of the 6 films in the Star Wars franchise?"
# We assume that a non-null value in this column indicates they have seen at least one film.
seen_films_count = df['Have you seen any of the 6 films in the Star Wars franchise?'].notna().sum()

# Count total respondents
total_respondents = len(df)

# Calculate the percentage
percentage_seen = (seen_films_count / total_respondents) * 100

# Report to four decimal places
print(f"{percentage_seen:.4f}")
```
